intro: Tchihatchewia isatidea, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and thrives in well-drained soil. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
